p: At the end of 2019, an unknown disease emerged and came into the spotlight. The disease caused pneumonia-like symptoms and lung fibrosis (Zhou et al. 2020). It emerged in the city of Wuhan, Hubei Province, China, which has a population of 11 million (Adhikari et al. 2020; Callaway et al. 2020; Chen et al. 2020; Fisher and Wilder-Smith 2020; Jingchun et al. 2020). China reported this pneumonia of unidentified cause first to the WHO country office on December 31, 2019 (WHO 2020). Since then, it has reported several thousand new cases of COVID-19. The peak of the epidemic in China was in late January and early February (Callaway et al. 2020). Up to January 31, 2020, COVID-19 had spread to 19 other countries, infecting 11,791 and causing 213 reported deaths. The COVID-19 epidemic was declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern by the World Health Organization on January 30, 2020 (WHO 2020; Adhikari et al. 2020). It has since developed into a global pandemic and has affected huge numbers of people in Iran, South Korea, and Italy and has pushed a spike in worldwide cases across over 150 countries (Callaway et al. 2020).
